Variable holding UHF Message data.
Timer for TimeOut Window A.
Timer for TimeOut Window B.
Function validating UHF message, based on function number.

Request validation of: transponderId (for each payload) & signature of raw UHF payload of received payload (only for FZV). Both requests are sent to CSH module using C/S interfaces. In addition battery level check is performed against invalid value. Then respective DTC event call is used.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
void
void Globals
sUHF_Message - read and write data.
Input->Output-Correlation
Battery Level DTCs (for all keys is tested). Signature and TransponderId C/S interface requests started: evCheckSignatureReq, evCheckTransponderID. Responds to be expected via callout functions from CSH module evCheckSignatureResp evCheckTransponderIDResp. Activity Diagram UHF_LFRange
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_UHF_MessageValidation
Traceability

Function for handling of DEM event interface.

Function is handling DEM event interface for all theoretically configurable key indicates regarding "Defective key battery measurement" fault.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint8
KeyIndex - key index with valid range 1..8 [in] Dem_EventStatusType status - if battery measurement level shows defective value, DTC = DEM_EVENT_STATUS_PREFAILED, otherwise = DEM_EVENT_STATUS_PREPASSED
void Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
For each key, there is assigned defective key DTC, which shall be tested. DTC is reported to DEM, which is accessible by diagnostic client (workshop, telemetric, HMI). Activity Diagram BatteryLevelDTC
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_BatteryLevelDTC

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8 ButtonCode, const uint8 KeyIndex, const boolean LFBit, const boolean LFRangeEntire, const boolean LFRangeTrunk)
memberdef.name: ButtonCodeReport

detaileddescription.para: Function proccessing UHF telegram button code.

Button code is mapped to specific logic RTE signal, according to SW requirements, in order to generate events for ZV functionality.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_172} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_255} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_246} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_671} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_675} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_676} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_677} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_250} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_686} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_716} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_718} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_254} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_689} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_717} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_247} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_251} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_253} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_252}
uint8
ButtonCode - code received from UHF telegram. [in] uint8 KeyIndex - valid range 1..8. [in] boolean LFBit - valid range 1..8. [in] boolean LFRangeEntire - valid range 1..8. [in] boolean LFRangeTrunk - valid range 1..8.
void Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
Input ButtonCode signal, is mapped to activation (=true) of specific RTE output signal. The signals are connected to and trigger ZV_Lib component to execute vehicle access operations. For few comfort signals (TRUNK, CONVERTIBLE), corresponding LF signals are set (LFBit, LFRange). TRUNK signal is handled in HandleButtonCodeTrunk function. Activity Diagram ButtonCodeReport
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_ButtonCodeReport

New frame counter vs previous received check.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_297} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_354}
uint8
pre - previous frame Id [in] uint8 cur - present frame Id
boolean - returns true if previous frame counter is smaller than present one or roll over from max to 0.
Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
Positive assumption, according to requirements is, that consecutive frame numbers are received during single button press. Verification allows further processing of present UHF telegram holding same code. Otherwise button press ended and output signals to be cleared in further processing flow. Activity Diagram FrameCounterVerify
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_FrameCounterVerify

Satisfies requirement

FDH internal mem compare function.

Function limited to amount of bytes used for TransponderId identification.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
uint8
tid_1[] - pointer to the buffer holding first transponder Id. [in] uint8 tid_2[] - pointer to the buffer holding second transponder Id.
boolean - true if both buffers hold same values, otherwise false.
Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
In use during UHF telegram processing flow, determining change of tke keyfob in consecutive UHF telegrams. If occurs, current Keyfob key press pending event should be ended and new one started. Activity Diagram TransponderIDComparison
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_TransponderIDComparison
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. Design decision: helper function to reduce evUHFEmpfang code size. FDH internal mem compare function. Please find detail information in the declaration above .
Function to handle received button code for trunk.

Function checks how ButtonCode 'Trunk Unlock trigger' should be interpreted.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_671} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_675} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_676} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_677}
boolean
*bFFBAnfCabinLock - pointer to flag informing if ButtonCode should be interpreted as Trunk unlock (in case of passenger vehicles). [out] boolean *bFFBAnfHDEntr - pointer to flag informing if ButtonCode should be interpreted as Cargo unlock (in case of cargo vehicles).
void Globals
N/A Input->Output-Correlation
Trunk Unlock trigger can be interpreted as Trunk unlock and Cargo unlock. The selection of the proper trigger is done based on the pa_NFZ_Schliessung adaptation's value. Activity Diagram HandleButtonCodeTrunk
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_HandleButtonCodeTrunk

Function to handle received button code for trunk.

Helper function for handling FZV telegram inside evUHFEmpfang

The simplified flow is: copy FZV payload to static buffer determine key number (from slot), validate key index (unset if invalid) recognize if FZV first telegram in burst -> set flag needed for WCZ processing recognize if frame counter change measn button code reset or just button code changes -> set button code reset flag
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_354} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_259}
boolean
bTransponderIdComparison - Transponder ID comparison result uint8 rawUHFPayload[] - raw data of telegram for parsing, includes WCZ, signature,... [out] boolean* out_bFunctionNumberValid - is FZV frame valid [out] boolean* out_bKeyIndexValid - is key index valid
void Globals
sUHF_Message sPayload.FZV - R/W access sUHF_Message u8KeyIndex - R/W sUHF_Message sFlags.LFBit - W sUHF_Message sFlags.LFRangeEntire - W sUHF_Message sFlags.LFRangeTrunk - W sUHF_Message sFlags.DiscardTelegram - R/W sUHF_Message sFlags.FirstFzvTelegram - W sUHF_Message sFlags.ValidFzv - R/W sUHF_Message sFlags.ResetButtonAction - W
Input->Output-Correlation
Callout from UHF Master on new telegram reception to initiate processing. sUHF internal message attributes/flags are filled in and message validation is next step, then UHF_CyclicHandle will process further the new telegram. Activity Diagram evUHFEmpfang_FZV
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_evUHFEmpfang_FZV

Helper function for handling COMFORT telegram inside evUHFEmpfang

The simplified flow is: if valid FZV (must be, comfort is continuation) - copy Comfort payload - copy LF bit, set LF range flags from Anp - determine key number (from slot), validate key index (unset if invalid) - recognize if button code changed or transponder Id is not as previous -> set button code reset flag
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must insure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_287} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_288} {SWR_L3_CRoute_FFB_283}
boolean
bTransponderIdComparison - Transponder ID comparison result uint8 rawUHFPayload[] - raw data of telegram for parsing, includes WCZ, signature,... [out] boolean* out_bFunctionNumberValid - is Comfort frame valid [out] boolean* out_bKeyIndexValid - is key index valid
void Globals
sUHF_Message sPayload.FZV - R access sUHF_Message sPayload.Comfort - R/W access sUHF_Message u8KeyIndex - R/W sUHF_Message u8RFFunctionNumber - R sUHF_Message sFlags.LFBit - W sUHF_Message sFlags.ValidFzv - R/W sUHF_Message sFlags.ResetButtonAction - W
Input->Output-Correlation
Callout from UHF Master on new telegram reception to initiate processing. sUHF internal message attributes/flags are filled in and message validation is next step, then UHF_CyclicHandle will process further the new telegram. Activity Diagram evUHFEmpfang_Comfort
Test Method
SWATT unit test. The testing method is described in TEST_evUHFEmpfang_Comfort

detailed multiline description of the file Verification criteria
